intro: Bikkia neriifolia, commonly known as the black-leaved bikkia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, almost black foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually arranged in terminal or axillary clusters. Bikkia neriifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils.
